overview: The <select> element is used to create a drop-down list. The <option> tags inside the <select> element define the available options in the list.
name: Select

description.en: Fires the moment when the value of the element is changed.
description.jp: Fires the moment when the value of the element is changed.

description.en: Fires when a user is pressing a key.
description.jp: Fires when a user is pressing a key.

description.en: Fires when a user releases a key.
description.jp: Fires when a user releases a key.

description.en: Fires on a mouse click on the element.
description.jp: Fires on a mouse click on the element.

description.en: Fires when the mouse pointer moves out of an element.
description.jp: Fires when the mouse pointer moves out of an element.

description.en: Fires when the mouse pointer moves over an element.
description.jp: Fires when the mouse pointer moves over an element.

description.en: Specifies that a drop-down list should be disabled.
description.jp: Specifies that a drop-down list should be disabled.

description.en: Specifies that multiple options can be selected at once.
description.jp: Specifies that multiple options can be selected at once.

description.en: Defines a name for the drop-down list.
description.jp: Defines a name for the drop-down list.

description.en: Specifies that the user is required to select a value before submitting the form.
description.jp: Specifies that the user is required to select a value before submitting the form.

description.en: Defines the number of visible options in a drop-down list.
description.jp: Defines the number of visible options in a drop-down list.

description.en: Specifies an inline CSS style for an element.
description.jp: Specifies an inline CSS style for an element.

description.en: Specifies extra information about an element.
description.jp: Specifies extra information about an element.
